description:
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus while being able to dive into the unique engineering challenges we face daily. As a Technical Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary engineering projects using your engineering expertise. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating them to project stakeholders. You're equally at home explaining your team's analyses and recommendations to executives as you are discussing the technical trade-offs in product development with engineers.

Using your extensive technical and leadership expertise, you manage projects of various size and scope, identifying future opportunities, improving processes and driving the technical directions of your programs.

In this role, you will be a key member of the Engineering team working to deliver feature requirements for the product in a timely manner for user facing, API and backend service deliverables. You will work closely with Engineering, UX, UX Research (UXR), Product Management (PM), and Partner Engineering to define these requirements. Additionally, you will work with Engineering to scope the resulting features and schedule the delivery. As a Technical Program Manager, you will ensure your areas can release reliably, predictably, and with high-quality at a predictable release cadence. You will play a key role in ensuring the requirements are captured, managing cross-group communication and technical dependencies with other Google teams, creating and driving the overall schedule, identifying and mitigating risk at all stages, defining the overall rhythm, and meeting touchpoints between teams. You will also triage incoming issues, analyze logs to focus root cause, and drive emerging feature areas that impact software releases as well as other areas in our product ecosystem.

As a Technical Program Manager, you will contribute excellent problem-solving, program delivery, and technical skills. Your experience in software product development and delivering complex large-scale hardware/software projects will be critical as you effectively work and adapt to a fast-paced and challenging environment. In this role, you will think critically, lead through intellect, and partner across a wide variety of functions within Google. You will take initiative and work directly and collaboratively on projects, demonstrating a passion for gaming, experience delivering user facing features, APIs, and backend services, and excellent communication skills.

Google's mission is to organize the world's information and make it universally accessible and useful. Our Hardware team researches, designs, and develops new technologies and hardware to make our user's interaction with computing faster, more powerful, and seamless. Whether finding new ways to capture and sense the world around us, advancing form factors, or improving interaction methods, our Hardware team is making people's lives better through technology.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent practical experience.
  • 4 years of experience in technical program management, managing technical software projects with internal engineering teams.
  • Experience delivering user interfaces, APIs, and/or backend service software.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience creating dashboard and queries using Dremel.
  • Knowledge of a scripting language such as Python.
  • Excellent project management skills.
responsibilities:
• Lead and manage cross-functionally to plan and prioritize development of user facing features, backend services, and a suite of APIs delivered directly to external partners on a regular release cycle.
  • Work closely with Engineering, Product Management, and other stakeholders to identify release vehicles, milestones, and deliverables. Create roadmaps, gather requirements, and prioritize new feature requests.
  • Develop tools (e.g., processes, techniques, automation) that lead and/or contribute to operational scalability for the internal product team.
  • Lead triage with Tech Leads of incoming issues for your areas from other developers and partners. Ensure fixes are identified, scheduled, and resolved.
  • Communicate status and health of the releases as it impacts internal stakeholder teams. Drive both inter and intra-team communications and establishing a consistent delivery rhythm, driving product excellence in all product releases.
title: Technical Program Manager, Stadia
